intro: Byttneria grandidieri, commonly known as the Madagascar sycamore, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is deciduous, shedding its leaves during the dry season, and produces woody capsules as its fruit. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
